mn42:1.1: This discourse is identical with the previous, except for the location, and a very slight difference in phrasing at [mn42:7.1]() compared to [mn41:7.1](). The Chinese parallels (SA 1042 and SA 1043 at T ii 272c-273b) are also nearly identical to each other, sharing the same location (Sāvatthī), varying only in the names of the brahmins and their manner of approaching the Buddha.
